  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO LEAKER ON DOOR 400. UPON ARRIVAIL IT WAS A LEAKING CORRISIVE HAZMAT. USING DECISION TREE AND PROPERT PPE CLEANED UP SPILL AND RETURNED TO CLERKS FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024080515
item.description:
Report E-2024080515

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) ounces of material was released due to a loose lid on one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. The loose lid was hand tightened and wiped clean with absorbent rags and then shipped onto the consignee. Clean Habor's personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and the spent absorbents were gathered and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum along with some impacted cardboard and PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
